title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
3 points

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement X as the empirical statement.

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement Y as the normative statement.

One point is earned for a correct explanation of the difference between a normative and an empirical statement.

An acceptable explanation is:

Normative statements contain subjective or value-related judgments, while empirical statements contain factual or objective statements.

A score of zero (0) is earned for an off-task answer or an attempted answer that merits no points.

A score of dash (â€”) is earned for a blank answer
descriptions:
The student failed to earn any of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement X as the empirical statement.  

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement Y as the normative statement.  

One point is earned for a correct explanation of the difference between a normative and an empirical statement. 

An acceptable explanation is: 

Normative statements contain subjective or value-related judgments, while empirical statements contain factual or objective statements.

The student earned one of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement X as the empirical statement.  

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement Y as the normative statement.  

One point is earned for a correct explanation of the difference between a normative and an empirical statement. 

An acceptable explanation is: 

Normative statements contain subjective or value-related judgments, while empirical statements contain factual or objective statements.

The student earned two of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement X as the empirical statement.  

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement Y as the normative statement.  

One point is earned for a correct explanation of the difference between a normative and an empirical statement. 

An acceptable explanation is: 

Normative statements contain subjective or value-related judgments, while empirical statements contain factual or objective statements.

The student earned three of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement X as the empirical statement.  

One point is earned for correctly identifying Statement Y as the normative statement.  

One point is earned for a correct explanation of the difference between a normative and an empirical statement. 

An acceptable explanation is: 

Normative statements contain subjective or value-related judgments, while empirical statements contain factual or objective statements.
